It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating to reduce water loss in high-altitude conditions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, adapting to the cool and short growing seasons of its habitat. Sporoxeia latifolia is known for its slow growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
